title: About Me
text:
View My CV
I’m currently completing my Public Health degree at Appalachian State University, where academic work, extracurricular activities, and research have fostered a strong passion for the field. Early in my major, I discovered a particular interest in the statistical applications of public health and quantitative methods. To build a strong foundation for biostatistical work, I pursued a Statistics minor and took foundational mathematics courses to strengthen my understanding of statistical and mathematical concepts. I’ve really enjoyed combining quantitative and qualitative approaches throughout my studies, and applying these skills to real-world projects has deepened both my understanding of and commitment to using biostatistics to address public health challenges.
My research interests focus on rural health and health behavior, particularly understanding and quantifying how rurality influences personal health choices and using this knowledge to reduce health disparities. I am also interested in applying statistical methods to evaluate innovative technological tools that improve healthcare access in hard-to-reach areas. These interests have been shaped by my coursework and extracurricular experiences.

title: About Me
text:
Academic & Professional Highlights


Public Health Departmental Honors Program
Honors Thesis
For my Honors thesis, I researched tick-borne illness prevention among long-distance Appalachian Trail hikers. This project involved designing a study from the ground up, including developing a survey, analyzing data, and authoring a formal manuscript. I established a professional partnership with the Appalachian Trail Conservancy, conducted a learning session on tick-borne illness at their Damascus Trail Center, and contributed a blog post on tick safety.







Public Health AmeriCorps Fellowship
Evaluation Team Lead & Lead Fellow
As evaluation team lead, I guided a team evaluating a public health intervention focused on rural mental health and analyzed program data to assess outcomes. Additionally, I authored an abstract based on our evaluation, presented the findings at the 2025 NC Data Summit, and attended the 2025 NACCHO Prep Summit.
In my second fellowship year, I serve as the Lead Fellow, supporting members, coordinating conference opportunities, and acting as a liaison between members and staff.







MaineHealth Institute for Research
Research Intern
During the Summer Undergraduate Research Program, I collaborated with Dr. Kahsi Pedersen on a project characterizing profound autism within specialized inpatient psychiatric facilities. I analyzed 15 years of data, used data visualization techniques, authored a manuscript, and presented findings through a poster and 3-Minute Thesis presentation. I was honored to receive the Paul Gray Research Scholarship.







AppHealthCare
YRBS Volunteer
Volunteering with AppHealthCare, I analyzed Youth Risk Behavior Survey data from six local schools, identifying patterns in youth risk behaviors across Western North Carolina. We created visualizations and summary reports for local stakeholders, informing public health strategies and supporting community decision-making.







Research Institute for Environment, Energy, and Economics
Research Assistantship
As a Research Assistant at Appalachian State University’s Research Institute for Environment, Energy, and Economics, I collaborated with a team analyzing crisis text conversations about eco-anxiety and climate worry. I contributed to a formal manuscript titled “Eco-Anxiety, Climate Concern, and Fatalistic Outlooks”, published in the Journal of Climate Change and Health.

title: Welcome!
text:
I’m a senior at Appalachian State University majoring in Public Health and minoring in Statistics. I’m excited about biostatistics, rural health, and health behavior. On this site, you’ll find examples of my projects, academic work, and research.


→ About Me → Portfolio → My CV

title: Welcome!
text:
What I’m Interested In


Biostatistics


Statistical methods for intervention evaluation, structural equation modeling, and data for public health decisions.



Health Behavior


Understanding how people make health decisions and how to support healthier choices.



Rural Health


Addressing health disparities and using innovative technology to expand healthcare access.









I’d love to hear from you! egracegetz@gmail.com | LinkedIn
